title: LLVM ERROR: Do not know how to split the result of this operator!

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-target-feature
labels.description: Area: Enabling/disabling target features like AVX, Neon, etc.

body: Greetings! I'm currently trying to compile my code on a bare metal target. However I get a LLVM error when I do so. The problem seems to come from libcore. ### Compilation command ``` RUSTFLAGS='-Zmacro-backtrace -Clink-dead-code' cargo +nightly build --verbose --target /home/luc/Desktop/dev/maestro/arch/x86/target.json --bin kernel ``` ### Code The full code is here: [https://github.com/llenotre/maestro/tree/module](https://github.com/llenotre/maestro/tree/module) Cargo.toml: ```toml [package] name = "maestro" version = "0.1.0" authors = ["llenotre "] edition = "2018" [lib] name = "abi" path = "src/mod_abi.rs" crate-type = ["dylib", "rlib"] [[bin]] name = "kernel" path = "src/kernel.rs" ``` arch/x86/target.json: ``` { "arch": "x86", "data-layout": "e-m:e-i32:32:32-f32:32:32-S16-p:32:32:32", "disable-redzone": true, "dynamic-linking": true, "executables": true, "features": "-mmx,-sse,+soft-float", "linker": "i686-elf-ld", "linker-flavor": "ld", "llvm-target": "i686-unknown-none", "os": "none", "panic-strategy": "abort", "target-c-int-width": "32", "target-endian": "little", "target-pointer-width": "32" } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.56.0-nightly (a6ece5615 2021-08-03) binary: rustc commit-hash: a6ece56152d8eb11e049e9fcce147b2859e12c92 commit-date: 2021-08-03 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.56.0-nightly LLVM version: 12.0.1 ``` ### Error output ``` LLVM ERROR: Do not know how to split the result of this operator! error: could not compile `core` Caused by: process didn't exit successfully: `rustc --crate-name core --edition=2018 /home/luc/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/core/src/lib.rs --error-format=json --json=diagnostic-rendered-ansi,artifacts --crate-type lib --emit=dep-info,metadata,link -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C metadata=5e0a9d73c690e322 -C extra-filename=-5e0a9d73c690e322 --out-dir /home/luc/Desktop/dev/maestro/target/target/debug/deps --target /home/luc/Desktop/dev/maestro/arch/x86/target.json -Z force-unstable-if-unmarked -L dependency=/home/luc/Desktop/dev/maestro/target/target/debug/deps -L dependency=/home/luc/Desktop/dev/maestro/target/debug/deps --cap-lints allow -Zsymbol-mangling-version=v0 -Zmacro-backtrace -Clink-dead-code` (exit status: 101) ```
